title: assoc type impl mismatch with trait assoc type doesnt mention where clauses

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
#![feature(generic_associated_types)]

trait Trait {
    type Assoc<'a>;
}

impl<'b> Trait for &'b () {
    type Assoc<'a>
    = &'a &'b ()
    where
        Self: 'a;
}
```

The current output is:

```
error: `impl` associated type signature for `Assoc` doesn't match `trait` associated type signature
 --> src/lib.rs:8:5
  |
4 |     type Assoc<'a>;
  |     -------------- expected
...
8 |     type Assoc<'a>
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ found
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error: `impl` associated type signature for `Assoc` doesn't match `trait` associated type signature
 --> src/lib.rs:8:5
  |
4 |     type Assoc<'a>;
  |     -------------- expected no where clause
...
8 |     type Assoc<'a>
  |     ...
  |     where
  |         Self: 'a;
  |         ^^^^^^^^ found where clause not present on trait definition
note: consider adding where clause to trait definition
  |
4 |    type Assoc<'a>
  |    where
  |        Self: 'a;
  |    +++++++++++++
```
